trans-unit.target: K'i taq Pixab rech usolik ri K'exk'olil rech Tzijob'exik rech Android
Ujachik pa k'at nek'ab'al maj k'a'm q'aq'(WiFi)

trans-unit.source: Problem: Android Device is not seeing book advertisements
trans-unit.target: K'axk'olil: Ri wiqkem chakub'al Android ma kuk'am ta jub'ixkil recj ri no'jwuj

trans-unit.source: When using this method, you need to run Bloom Reader, open its menu, and choose "Receive from WiFi".
trans-unit.target: Are chi' koksax we binib'al, rajawaxik uchakuxik Bloom Reader. Chtoro' ri Cholb'al chak xuquje' chcha' "Uk'amik rech jachnak' k'at" (WiFi).

trans-unit.source: Make sure the device is in the "Receive from WiFi" screen
trans-unit.target: Chwila' che ri jachnak' k'at k'o pa uwach kematz'ib' "Uk'amik rech jachnak' k'at" (WiFi)"

trans-unit.source: Make sure the computer and device are on the same WiFi network. A computer plugged in via cable to the WiFi router still may be on its own network. It is technically possible to connect wired networks to be able to be on the same local subnet as WiFi, but the Bloom team will not be able to provide any help in setting that up, sorry.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the computer and device are on the same WiFi network. A computer plugged in via cable to the WiFi router still may be on its own network. It is technically possible to connect wired networks to be able to be on the same local subnet as WiFi, but the Bloom team will not be able to provide any help in setting that up, sorry.

trans-unit.source: Make sure your computer doesn't have a firewall that is interfering. The windows Firewall will display when you first start advertising a book. If you said "No" to that, it might not ever ask you again. If you have additional 3rd party firewalls installed, try disabling them. Bloom advertises a book by broadcasting on the local net via UDP on port 5913, and Bloom Reader requests a book via port 5915.
trans-unit.target: Chwila' che ri akematz'ib' ma k'o ta rech ri uk'ulel q'aq' (firewall) che tajan kuyojij. Ri uk'ulel q'aq' rech Windows kuk'ut na rib' are chi' k'ate kumaj ujachik uno'jwuj. We xab'ij "No" chech are', kaj ne ma kuk'ot ta chik achi'. We ne k'o chik nik'aj k'ulel q'aq' jeqb'am chik, chb'ana' pe uchupik. Bloom kujach jun no'jwuj chi upam ri waral k'at rumal ri rech UDP chi upam ri q'axeb'al 5913 xuquje' Bloom Reader chta jun no'jwuj chi upam ri q'axeb'al 5915.

trans-unit.source: Problem: Bloom is not connecting to my device
trans-unit.target: Problem: Bloom is not connecting to my device

source.g: We have found this method to be problematic with many devices, so consider using the WiFi method even if you are only working with a single device.

target.g: We have found this method to be problematic with many devices, so consider using the WiFi method even if you are only working with a single device.

trans-unit.source: When using this method, you do not have to go into any special mode to receive books. Just run Bloom Reader. Books should automatically appear when they are transferred.
trans-unit.target: Are we kakoj we b'inib'al, ma kuya taj katokik pa jun chik chech uk'amik no'jwuj. Xuw chakuj Bloom Reader. Ri k'i taq wuj ke'el uloq kitukel wi are chi' keq'axexik.

trans-unit.source: Some Android devices have multiple modes they can be in when connected to a computer. Some will ask you as soon as you connect the cable to the computer. Bloom will be trying to talk to the device using a protocol called "MTP". If you're not sure that your device is connecting using MTP, try googling the name of your device + "MTP".
trans-unit.target: Some Android devices have multiple modes they can be in when connected to a computer. Some will ask you as soon as you connect the cable to the computer. Bloom will be trying to talk to the device using a protocol called "MTP". If you're not sure that your device is connecting using MTP, try googling the name of your device + "MTP".

trans-unit.source: The device should be showing up in Windows File Explorer (this feature is Windows-only)
trans-unit.target: The device should be showing up in Windows File Explorer (this feature is Windows-only)

trans-unit.source: Try a different cable, or a different USB port.
trans-unit.target: Try a different cable, or a different USB port.
